intro: Aeschynanthus copelandii, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are slender and can trail or climb. Aeschynanthus copelandii is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate with proper care.
